basics.name: Duncan Calvert
basics.label: AI Product Manager | ML Engineer
basics.summary: AI-focused product manager and data scientist specialized in natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning (ML) systems. Skilled in driving cross-functional automation initiatives, full product lifecycles, and leading teams to align AI innovation with their business goals.

work.name: Wells Fargo
highlights: Built an enterprise-wide internal support application used by 40k users that drives efficiency savings of $6.3M/year
Implemented a suite of AI agents leveraging MLLMs, RAG, Ragas, and vector databases that automates 30% of total user support issues and saves 4k hours/year of SME time
Managing 80+ RPA automations to systematically handle risk and operations, eliminating 15k toil hours/year
Authored an AI product management framework adopted by leadership to standardize AI product development across all PMs in our group

work.name: University of Chicago, Data Science Institute
work.summary: Provided technical guidance in ML, computer vision (CV), control systems, embedded systems, CAD, simulation environments, and GCP cloud engineering
highlights: 5x ADSP 32018 Next-Gen Natural Language Processing: Transformers, LLMs and Agentic AI
4x ADSP 34003 Data Science for Robotics (Research Capstone) time

work.name: Wells Fargo

Founded The Paper Collective, a monthly academic paper discussion and research group with 50+ monthly participants

highlights: Mediated between the UC Police Department, County Sheriff Department, student body, and long-term resident populations

Founded the community outreach programs 'Pizza with Police' and 'Coffee with a Cop' in which top police staff discussed law enforcement policy and fielded Q&A in an effort to foster a culture of community policing

Assisted project leaders with the successful passage of Assembly Bill AB3 Ch. 548, which legally transitioned Isla Vista from an unincorporated territory to a Community Service District (approved by Governor Jerry Brown Oct. 7th, 2015)
Fostered a system of community policing within the UCSB Police Department and Santa Barbara County Sheriff's Dept. that worked to change policies and enforcement to better address community needs
Founded and secured funding for the grass-roots UCIV volunteer program, the core policy solution during the unsanctioned festival weekends of Deltopia and Halloween

projects.name: KScanner: A Python Library for Automated Clustering
projects.summary: KScanner is a novel combination of DBSCAN and K-Means clustering that uses automated Epsilon and MinPts approximation to identify the correct model parameters for DBSCAN. The output of DBSCAN is then fed to K-Means as the value for n_clusters to lower the total amount of iterations to determine appropriate cluster amounts.

projects.name: UCSB Reads: Community Policing and Just Mercy
projects.summary: In collaboration with the UC Santa Barbara Library, I developed a community round-table event which brought together Isla Vista Foot Patrol and UC Police Department officers to discuss issues related to mass incarceration, the death penalty, and racial bias. The event functioned in conjunction with the larger UCSB Reads program and its annual book choice, Just Mercy, by Bryan Stevenson. The discussion was moderated by the Honorable Frank J. Ochoa, Retired Santa Barbara County Superior Court Judge.
